issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Improve exception checking in FileContext related JUnit tests

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.summary: local FileContext does not rename .crc file

comments.body:
[~y0un5] I cannot reproduce the situation with {{.old.crc}}, {{.new.crc}} and {{old.crc}}, {{new.crc}} with given code in trunk.
Is it already fixed in trunk?

No, I can reproduce the bug in trunk. I've added test cases to my fork([link|https://github.com/y0un5/hadoop/commit/f281d82097d27d2a0f60bab29173e183db788382]).
TestFileContextDeleteOnExit#testRenameCrc() is for the local FileContext, TestLocalFileSystem#testRenameCrc() is for the local FileSystem.
TestLocalFileSystem#testRenameCrc() succeeds, but TestFileContextDeleteOnExit#testRenameCrc() fails.

The problem is that {{ChecksumFS}} has no {{renameInternal(Path, Path, boolean)}} method.
FileContext calls {{AbstractFileSystem#rename(Path, Path, Options...}} which calls {{renameInternal(Path, Path, boolean)}}. Since {{ChecksumFS}} has no this method the call will land in {{FilterFS}} which does not care with the crc files. I added the missing method to {{ChecksumFS}}.

[~boky01], i don't think so , the implement of {{rename}} of LocalFileContext is different from {{LocalFileSystem}}#{{rename}}. The junit test failure of reporter is caused by the nonexistance  of file {{newCrcPath}},

set {{fs.AbstractFileSystem.file.impl}} to {{org.apache.hadoop.fs.LocalFileSystem}} may solve this problem. [~y0un5] 

*Update*

forgot this, i misktaked the version of hadoop
